intro: Bunium oeroilanicum, commonly known as the Crimean fennel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Crimean Peninsula and parts of southern Russia. The plant features slender, aromatic stems and compound umbels of small white flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild anise-like scent. Bunium oeroilanicum is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is valued for its ornamental and potential medicinal properties.
